An official website of the United States government

The .gov means it’s official.
Federal government websites always use a .gov or .mil domain. Before sharing sensitive information online, make sure you’re on a .gov or .mil site by inspecting your browser’s address (or “location”) bar.

This site is also protected by an SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) certificate that’s been signed by the U.S. government. The https:// means all transmitted data is encrypted  — in other words, any information or browsing history that you provide is transmitted securely.

Mike’s Garage Contributor: Allen Hambry

  • General Assessment
  • Prior 8(a) Involvement
  • Outside Assistance
  • Business Size
    • Size Determination

General Assessment

Is the firm organized for profit?

Response: Yes

Is the applicant firm operating as a broker?

Response: Yes

Warning!

In order to participate in 8(a) Business Development Program, the applicant firm must not be a broker. Please email 8aBD@sba.gov for assistance if you are unsure about your status as a broker. Include your firm name, DUNS number and address in the email.



Has the firm generated any revenue?

Are all of the individual(s) claiming disadvantaged status in the applicant firm U.S. citizens?

Response: Yes

Does the applicant firm have a Doing Business As (DBA) Name?

Response: Na

Prior 8(a) Involvement

Has the firm previously been certified as an 8(a) participant?

Response: No

Has the applicant firm ever submitted an application to the 8(a) Business Development Program?

Response: No

Do the assets of a previously certified 8(a) Business Development Program Participant constitute 50% or more of applicant firm’s assets?

Response: No

Outside Assistance

Did the applicant firm hire an outside consultant to assist with its 8(a) application?

Response: Yes

Attachments:

File Name Document Type Upload Date
MainTestUploadDoc.pdf Representative Information Form 08/09/2017

Business Size

Is the firm considered small in accordance with its primary North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code?

Response: No

Warning!

To qualify for the 8(a) Business Development Program, the applicant firm must meet SBA’s small business size standards. Please email 8aBD@sba.gov for assistance if you are unsure if the firm meets SBA’s small business size standards. Include your firm name, DUNS number and address in the email.



Has the applicant firm or any of its affiliates received a formal SBA size determination?

Response: No

Do you need the firm to provide revisions to this section?

If you need the firm to make corrections or provide information that is not included in the original questionnaire, you may request revisions on this section

Your experience is important to us. Please email us at  certify@sba.gov  with comments or suggestions.
